inputAnalysis.detectedScope: Single university course (L1/Licence 1, Semester 1) covering Archaic Greek history from 8th-6th century BCE, focusing on polis emergence, colonization, and political innovations

metadata.description: Study of past events, civilizations, and human societies
The Archaic Greek World: emergence, diffusion and transformation of the polis (8th-6th century BCE)
metadata.originalTitle: Le monde grec archaïque : émergence, diffusion et mutation de la polis (VIIIe-VIe siècle avant notre ère)

extractionMetadata.processingNotes: Moderate-scope input: Single L1 university course covering archaic Greek history (8th-6th century BCE). Created 5-level hierarchical structure with comprehensive coverage of polis emergence, colonization movement, and socio-political transformations. Input was in French; all node names translated to English while preserving original course metadata. The course emphasizes cross-source analysis and anthropological methodology, which is reflected in the Historical Methodology section. Depth: 5 levels (Subject → Course → Subdirectories → Sub-subdirectories → Atomic Concepts). All 55 concepts pass the ONE flashcard test and align with learning objectives focused on understanding archaic Greek foundations through source analysis and anthropological methods.
